title.narrative: Prevention of Child Mariage ON costs

description.narrative: The proposed action aims to further contribute to a reduction of child marriage in six countries: Niger, Mali, Pakistan, Afghanistan, India and Bangladesh. The rationale for the six target countries is predominantly based on high prevalence of child marriages. Mali too has one of the highest child marriage prevalence rates in the world, on average, one out of two girls will be married by age 18. In 2010, 55 percent of the women 20-24 years of age were married/in union before age 18. Child marriage is a violation of child rights. It denies the child, the basic right to good health, nutrition, education, and freedom from violence, abuse and exploitation. Child marriage also denies the child the right to be precisely that: a child, as it removes her/him from the care and protection of her/his family (and in most cases from school too) and throws her/him prematurely into the world of adults, with a number of burdens and responsibilities that the child is not prepared for. Although child marriage has a negative impact on boys and girls alike, the consequences are much more severe for girls and young women who often lack the status and power within their marriages and their households. Save the Children and Oxfam Novib propose an integrated strategy that builds on current programming and complements thatof others, whilst strengthening the work of Government and community based agencies and fills the gaps in the target locations in the six countries. The overall programme proposal focuses on the six strategies as formulated by UNFPA and the Dutch MOFA in its Child Marriage Fund, whereby priority, type and number of strategies differ per proposed target areas as follows: 1. Empower girls and enhance their position through developing their knowledge and skillsregarding SRHR and rights (in Afghanistan, Niger, Mali, India, Bangladesh, ) 2. Increasing access to formal education for girls (in Afghanistan, Niger) 3. Work with local communities to address harmful traditional/social norms and practices (in Afghanistan, Niger, Mali, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh) 4. Improve the economic situation of vulnerable girls and their families(in Afghanistan, Bangladesh) 5. Development and support for implementation of child marriage legislation and policy (in India, Bangladesh) 6. Improve access to SRH services for married and unmarried girls. (in Niger, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh)

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
